title: How can I use qmake to compile C++ application linking against OpenCV and libTorch?
body_html:
🐛 Bug

To Reproduce

Similar to #13541 I'd like to use qmake to build but I still get some errors even if I added QMAKE_CXXFLAGS += -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0,

/opt/rh/devtoolset-3/root/usr/libexec/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.9.2/ld: cannot find -lnvrtc

the shared libraries I found in path/to/libtorch/lib/ is only something like this:

libnvrtc-007d19c9.so.9.0
libnvrtc-builtins.so

So I thought maybe I should linked this as -lnvrtc-007d19c9 or -lnvrtc-builtins but after I did that the error still exist.

I tried cmake but when I add opencv to it , it can't find opencv's include file.

fatal error: opencv2/core.hpp: no such a file or directory

Expected behavior

Environment

  • PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0):1.0
  • OS (e.g., Linux):centos
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • Python version:3.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version:9.0
  • GPU models and configuration:
  • Any other relevant information:

## 🐛 Bug

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## To Reproduce

Similar to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/13541 I'd like to use qmake to build but I still get some errors even if I added ```QMAKE_CXXFLAGS += -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0```,

> /opt/rh/devtoolset-3/root/usr/libexec/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.9.2/ld: cannot find -lnvrtc

the shared libraries I found  in path/to/libtorch/lib/  is only something like this:
>libnvrtc-007d19c9.so.9.0
  libnvrtc-builtins.so

So I thought  maybe I should linked this as ```-lnvrtc-007d19c9``` or ```-lnvrtc-builtins```  but after I did that the error still exist.

I tried cmake but when I add opencv to it , it can't find opencv's include file.
>fatal error: opencv2/core.hpp: no such a file or directory
